title: [dir]
description: The `dir` HTML attribute specifies text directionality as either left-to-right or right-to-left, essential for bi-directional text in languages like Hebrew.
content: The attribute that sets the text direction for an element, determining whether the content is displayed left-to-right ('ltr') or right-to-left ('rtl'). It's useful for supporting different languages and ensuring proper text alignment.
